business.headline: Aviation regulator suspends 2 Akasa Air officials for lapses in pilots trainingThe two senior executives of the airline have reportedly failed to ensure compliances with the civil aviation requirements, Directorate General of Civil Aviation said.
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.

How Manmohan Singh revitalised India's economy and global standingAs the chief architect of India's 1991 economic liberalisation, Manmohan Singh's policies helped steer India away from a severe financial crisis, positioning the country as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Osamu Suzuki, former Suzuki Motor Corporation chairman, dies at 94Osamu Suzuki steered Suzuki Motor's rise, from pioneering Maruti 800 in India to building a global automotive legacy.

How Indian stock market benefitted under Manmohan SinghManmohan Singh's policies, introduced during a time of economic crisis in the early 1990s, reshaped India's economy and transformed the Indian stock markets.

10 income tax changes in 2024: What you need to know for filing ITR in 2025The 2024 income tax reforms introduce revised tax slabs, higher deductions, and simplified TDS and capital gains rules, making tax filing easier and offering potential savings.

Bumper stock market debut for Mamata Machinery: Should you book profit or wait? Mamata Machinery stock market listing: A 147% premium debut for Mamata Machinery leaves investors wondering: Is this the peak, or should they hold on?

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong market debut: Is it a long-term bet?DAM Capital Advisors market listing: The listing matched market predictions, as analysts and the grey market premium (GMP) had anticipated a 40%-50% premium, driven by robust demand and positive sentiment.

Sanathan Textiles shares list at 31% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Sanathan Textiles stock market debut: The listing comes after the company's initial public offering (IPO) witnessed robust demand, with subscriptions exceeding 36 times the total shares on offer.

Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price is down 50% on some trading apps todayMazagon Dock stock price: Certain trading apps may be displaying the unadjusted previous closing price, leading to the perception of a 50% fall. Adjusted for the split, Mazagon Dock shares were trading 2.13% lower on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:09 am.

Transrail Lighting shares list at 36% premium on Dalal Street debut Transrail Lighting share price: The shares opened at Rs 585.15 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The market debut aligns with market expectations, which was oversubscribed by 81 times.

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong debut, shares list at 39% premium DAM Capital Advisors listing: On the BSE, the shares began trading at Rs 392.90, marking a 38.83% premium compared to the issue price.

Mamata Machinery shares make bumper debut with 147% premium over IPO priceMamata Machinery listing: Shares of Mamata Machinery made a bumper debut and listed at Rs 600 per share on the NSE, a lot higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 243 per share.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as auto stocks fuel early rally; Tata Motors up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 323.12 points to 78,795.60, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 101.95 points to 23,852.15 as of 9:44 AM.

Dam Capital to Mamata Machinery: GMPs of 5 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayThese initial public offerings (IPOs), which opened for subscription on December 19 and closed on December 23, collectively raised over Rs 2,900 crore.

Manmohan Singh's key reforms that shaped Indian economyDr Manmohan Singh's tenure as Finance Minister in the early 1990s and later as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 introduced policies that continue to influence India's growth.

Gautam Adani on work-life balance: Spend at least 4 hours with familyChairperson of Adani Group, Gautam Adani, shared his take on work-life balance and said one must try to spend at least four hours with their families.

Government may consider tax relief for income of up to Rs 10.50 lakh: ReportThe move, likely to be announced in the upcoming Budget 2025 on February 1, aims to boost consumption and address concerns over rising living costs amid a slowing economy.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India bids farewell to Manmohan Singh, PM, top leaders pay final tributes Live UpdatesManmohan Singh will be cremated with full state honours today. The Centre agreed to allocate space for a memorial of the former Prime Minister after a war of words broke out between the BJP and the Congress.

Amid Manmohan Singh's memorial row, Pranab Mukherjee's daughter's dig at CongressSharmistha Mukherjee criticised the party for demanding a separate memorial space for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh while failing to convene a Working Committee meeting to condole her father's death.

Manmohan Singh: Accidental PM, but not an accidental politicianManmohan Singh served as the Prime Minister of India for 10 years, but people still perceive that he was politically naive. That couldn't be further from the truth. Singh survived in the Congress by picking his battles well even as astute politicians fell along the way.

Sparkling Nitish hundred, Sundar rearguard cut India's deficit on Day 3Australia vs India: Nitish Reddy's maiden Test hundred, combined with Washington Sundar's fighting fifty, helped India cut Australia's first-innings lead on Day 3 of the ongoing Boxing Day Test.

Manjummel Boys to Aavesham: 2024 truly belonged to Malayalam cinema From big hits to bigger misses to the explosive Hema Committee report, Malayalam cinema experienced highs and lows in 2024. Here's a round-up of what transpired in Mollywood this year.

Centre breaks deadlock with late-night nod for Manmohan Singh's memorial The Congress's request for the cremation to be held at a separate memorial site was initially denied by the Centre, following which party leader Jairam Ramesh called it a "deliberate insult to India's first Sikh Prime Minister".

Nitish Reddy's father in tears after prayers answered for son's MCG hundredIND vs AUS: Nitish Kumar Reddy's father was in tears after his son's nervy century in the Boxing Day Test. Nitish created history by becoming the first India No.8 to score a hundred in Australia.

Delhi records highest single-day December rainfall in 101 yearsRain continued to lash several places in Delhi-NCR on Saturday, causing average daily temperatures to drop sharply. The IMD has issued a 'yellow' alert for the weekend, predicting more showers.

Boxing Day heist: Owner's invite to 'rob' his store sparks all-out frenzyAs soon as the store in Perth opened its shutters on Thursday, hundreds of teens pushed and shoved their way into the shop, resulting in a massive stampede.

Not his well-wishers: Supreme Court raps farm leaders over Dallewal's healthFarmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has been on a fast-unto-death since November 26 to press the Centre to accept the demand of MSP for crops.

Republican candidate's mock execution of migrant in video: 'Deserve to be ended'In the video, Valentina Gomez is seen firing a handgun into the back of the head of a dummy tied to a chair with a black bag over its head. She asserts that undocumented persons who commit violent crimes "deserve to be ended."

Bengaluru founder turns cab driver at 3 am as sleepy chauffeur hands over keys. VideoSharing a video in a post on Instagram, a Bengaluru-based founder narrated the story when he ended up driving his own cab at 3am after his drowsy driver could no longer stay awake.

Heard loud bang, began to pray: Kazakhstan plane crash survivors recount ordealAn Azerbaijan Airlines plane crashed in Kazakhstan, killing 38 passengers after reportedly encountering two loud bangs mid-flight, survivors recalled.

Stupid, Stupid, Stupid: Furious Gavaskar slams Pant for reckless dismissalIND vs AUS: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar was furious with India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant for throwing away his wicket on Day 3 of the MCG Test match. Gavaskar called Pant stupid and said the left-hander should have walked back to the Australian dressing room instead of the Indian one.

KT Rama Rao summoned by ED in Formula-E race case on January 7A case has been filed by probe agency ED against BRS leader KT Rama Rao and two others over alleged irregularities to the tune of Rs 55 crore in hosting the Formula-E race in Hyderabad in February 2023.

In Pics: Srinagar wrapped in white after season's first snowfallSrinagar received the season's first snowfall on Friday, draping the valley in white and bringing cheer to locals and tourists alike. Under the influence of a western disturbance, light to moderate snowfall was recorded in most areas of Kashmir, including Srinagar and other areas.  The much-awaited snowfall brought relief and joy to the people. Tourists were thrilled to witness snow and many of them were seen playing and clicking photographs.

Manmohan Singh sometimes skipped meal, lived on chocolate bar in UK: DaughterFormer Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's daughter, Daman Singh, wrote a book titled 'Strictly Personal: Manmohan and Gursharan', in 2014 to tell the story of her parents.

Pollution curbs under GRAP-3 revoked in Delhi-NCR as air quality improvesDelhi Air Quality: The anti-pollution restrictions under Stage 3 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) were lifted in the Delhi-NCR region on Friday after air quality improved, with the 24-hour average AQI at 324 by 7 pm.

Priyanka Chopra-Nick celebrate fun-filled Christmas with daughter, friendsPriyanka Chopra celebrated Christmas with her family and loved ones at her Los Angeles residence. The actor recently shared a glimpse of her festive celebrations by posting a series of heartwarming photos on her Instagram.

Romeo and Juliet actor Olivia Hussey dies at 73Veteran actor Olivia Hussey, best known for her role in Romeo and Juliet, passed away at the age of 73, surrounded by her loved ones. She was first diagnosed with breast cancer in 2008, which recurred in 2018.

Badshah deletes Instagram posts after Honey Singh breaks silence on their feudAfter Honey Singh spoke out about his decade-long feud with Badshah, he deleted all his Instagram posts. Earlier, in an interview with India Today, Honey Singh dismissed Badshah's gesture to reconcile and end their feud.

Carlsen trolls Chess Federation with OOTD post after quitting championshipThe world's best chess player Magnus Carlsen quit the 2024 World Rapid and Blitz Championship after being fined by FIDE over dress code. Carlsen trolled the tournament with a cheeky post on social media after quitting.

Bumrah breaks silence on Sam Konstas' onslaught from Day 1 of MCG TestIND vs AUS: Star India pacer Jasprit Bumrah breaks his silence on Sam Konstas after their incredible battle on Day 1 of the Boxing Day Test match. Unorthodox Konstas hit Bumrah for 2 sixes. This was the first time in 3 years that Bumrah was hit for a six in Test cricket.

Cloudy skies and fluctuating conditions could challenge both teams as India fight to avoid the follow-on against Australia.

Sunil Gavaskar highlights Rohit Sharma's selection blunders in Melbourne TestFormer India cricketer turned commentator Sunil Gavaskar has expressed disappointment over captain Rohit Sharma's team selection in the ongoing fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne.

Kevin Pietersen backs Virat Kohli amid immense scrutiny in MelbourneKevin Pietersen hails Virat Kohli as cricket's ultimate entertainer, defending him amid intense scrutiny during the Melbourne Test. Despite criticism, Pietersen believes Kohli's theatrics and achievements make the game far more captivating than it would be without him.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
